<< uint32 integers type uint8 >>

uint64

Converts to 64-bit unsigned intege.

Syntax

Y = uint64(X)

Input argument

X

a matrix of double, single or integers.

Output argument

Y

a matrix of 64-bit unsigned integer.

Description

uint64 converts value to 64-bit unsigned integer type.

The value is rounded to the nearest uint64 value on conversion. A value that is above or below the range for an uint64 class is mapped to one of the endpoints of the range [0, 18446744073709551616].

Example

A = [1 12 -120 127 -9e24 9e23]
B = uint64(A)

See also

intmax, intmin.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET

<< uint32 integers type uint8 >>
